sections.heading: Core Function
sections.content:
よね combines よ (emphasis) + ね (confirmation) = emphasized confirmation .

"That's right, isn't it?" with more confidence than ね alone.

sections.heading: Main Use
sections.content:
Seeking strong agreement/confirmation:

美味しいですよね "It's delicious, right?" (expecting yes) 明日は休みですよね "Tomorrow's a holiday, right?" これは難しいですよね "This is difficult, isn't it?" (expecting agreement)

sections.heading: よね vs ね
sections.content: ね = gentle confirmation 美味しいですね - "It's delicious, isn't it?" よね = stronger confirmation/expectation 美味しいですよね - "It's delicious, right?" (more certain)

sections.heading: Common Patterns
sections.content: [Statement]よね そうですよね - "That's right, isn't it?" [Adjective]よね 高いですよね - "It's expensive, right?" [Verb]よね 分かりますよね - "You understand, right?"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Combination of よ + ね ✓ Stronger than ね alone ✓ Expecting agreement ✓ Natural in conversation

Related:

よ (yo) - Emphasis ね (ne) - Confirmation
